intro: Tetramerium macrostachyum, commonly known as the large-stalked tetramerium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves with serrated edges. Its inflorescence consists of clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, typical of the Rubiaceae family.
